--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Chris Barham" <cbarham@...>=
 wrote:
>
> Hi,
> (Also cross-posted to the TestNG list - apologies if you =
get this twice)
> 
> I am trying to evaluate JUnit 4and TestNG.
> 
> I have=
 built classes that use the backwards compatibility of each of
> the newer =
test frameworks to enable the reuse of existing JUnit 3.8
> style test help=
er classes, (these exercise
> equals/hashcode/serializable/comparable and a=
ccessors and come from
> the Junit addons project and the TestUtil project)=
.
> 
> Although each testcase works, I'm not entirely happy I am 'doing it
=
right'.
> 
> For example the JUnit 4 code is not working as I expected when=
 I used
> the @RunWith(Enclosed.class)
> annotation - it only picks up the =
enclosed classes, not the public
> 'outer' class.
> 
> Also, the TestNG cod=
e must implement TestCase because the non-public
> classes are JUnit 3.8 st=
yle, and setting the compatibility option
> seems to  preclude using TestNG=
 style tests in the public class.
> 
> To illustrate I have a toy class und=
er test, (Person), and a testcase
> for this implemented in each framework.=
 I've posted this code up here:
> http://javaunittest.pbwiki.com/
> for dis=
cussion and correction by anyone and everyone.
> 
> Would members of the li=
st mind having a look over the code and
> suggesting improvements?
> 
> Man=
y Thanks!
> Chris
>
